      • disBetweenPoints

        public double disBetweenPoints(int x,
                               int y)
        In this method the coordinates of the points (x,y) have been sent as arguments to calculate the distance between the two points
        Parameters:
        x - is the x coordinate of the point
        y - is the y coordinate of the point
        Returns:
        the distance between the two points

                              Point P2)
        Static distance method with objects sent as arguments
        Parameters:
        P1 - point 1 sent as an argument
        P2 - point 2 sent as an argument
        Returns:

      • mirrorAtOrigin

        public Point mirrorAtOrigin()
        It performs the mirror operation e.g. (x,y) = (-x, -y)
        Returns:
        the mirrored point

      • mirrorAtAxis

        public Point mirrorAtAxis()
        The mirror operation is performed about the line with 45 degree slope (y=x) e.g. (x,y) = (y,x)
        Returns:
        the mirrored point

      • getLoc

        public Point getLoc()
        It will return the object as we want to have both x and y coordinates at the same time and by calling a single method. Else we can do it separately via getX() and getY() methods, which can be boring and too much work when your program gets bigger.
        Returns:
        the location of the current point

        It will convert the output to the readable form
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        the string in readable form
